page.title: 01BRIDGES OVER MENAI
page.content: The attractive scenery of this part of the Menai Strait is created by wooded shores, especially fringing Plas Newydd and Vayrol estates, fast tidal flows, small islands and the bridges linking the North Wales mainland to the island of Anglesey. Thomas Telford's 1826 Menai Bridge, widened but still graceful, is a fine viewpoint and key element in the landscape. The solid, clean lines of Robert Stephenson's 1850 Britannia Bridge carrying the Holyhead railway have been lost through rebuilding, but the added road deck, with connecting by passes, gives an essential second road link for Anglesey. Part of the small town of Menai Bridge is included, as is most of the much expanded residential community of the village of Llantair Pg. On the mainland side, part of the Penrhos
